title: Midjourney
content:
{{Short description|Image-generating machine learning model}} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2023}} {{Infobox software | name = Midjourney | logo = Midjourney Emblem.svg | logo caption = Logo | logo size = 250px | caption = | developer = Midjourney, Inc. | released = {{Start date and age|2022|7|12}} (open beta) | latest release version = | latest release date = | repo = | programming language = | operating system = | genre = | license = | website = {{url|https://www.midjourney.com/|midjourney.com}} }} {{Artificial intelligence}} '''Midjourney''' is a [[generative artificial intelligence]] program and service created and hosted by [[San Francisco]]–based independent research lab Midjourney, Inc. Midjourney [[text-to-image model|generates images from natural language descriptions]], called ''[[Prompt engineering|prompts]]'', similar to [[OpenAI]]'s [[DALL-E]] and [[Stability AI]]'s [[Stable Diffusion]].{{cite news |title=Huge "foundation models" are turbo-charging AI progress |url=https://www.economist.com/interactive/briefing/2022/06/11/huge-foundation-models-are-turbo-charging-ai-progress |newspaper=The Economist |access-date=26 June 2022 |archive-date=November 17, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221117045219/https://www.economist.com/interactive/briefing/2022/06/11/huge-foundation-models-are-turbo-charging-ai-progress |url-status=live }}{{cite web |last1=Hertzmann |first1=Aaron |title=Give this AI a few words of description and it produces a stunning image – but is it art? |url=https://theconversation.com/give-this-ai-a-few-words-of-description-and-it-produces-a-stunning-image-but-is-it-art-184363 |website=The Conversation |date=10 June 2022 |access-date=26 June 2022 |language=en |archive-date=June 10, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220610123758/https://theconversation.com/give-this-ai-a-few-words-of-description-and-it-produces-a-stunning-image-but-is-it-art-184363 |url-status=live }} It is one of the technologies of the [[AI boom|AI Spring]]. The tool is currently in [[open beta]], which it entered on July 12, 2022.{{Cite tweet |number=1547108864788553729 |user=midjourney |title=We're officially moving to open-beta! Join now at https://discord.gg/midjourney. **Please read our directions carefully** or check out our detailed how-to guides here: https://midjourney.gitbook.io/docs. Most importantly, have fun! |date=July 12, 2022 |access-date=August 31, 2022}} The Midjourney team is led by [[David Holz]], who co-founded [[Leap Motion]].{{cite news |last1=Rose |first1=Janus |title=Inside Midjourney, The Generative Art AI That Rivals DALL-E |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/wxn5wn/inside-midjourney-the-generative-art-ai-that-rivals-dall-e |publisher=[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]] |date=July 18, 2022 |access-date=July 21, 2022 |archive-date=September 1, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220901124218/https://www.vice.com/en/article/wxn5wn/inside-midjourney-the-generative-art-ai-that-rivals-dall-e |url-status=live }} Holz told ''[[The Register]]'' in August 2022 that the company was already profitable.{{cite news |last1=Claburn |first1=Thomas |title=Holz, founder of AI art service Midjourney, on future images |url=https://www.theregister.com/2022/08/01/david_holz_midjourney/ |access-date=September 5, 2022 |work=The Register |date=August 1, 2022 |language=en |archive-date=November 12, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221112153637/https://www.theregister.com/2022/08/01/david_holz_midjourney/ |url-status=live }} Users create artwork with Midjourney using [[Discord]] bot commands.{{cite news |last1=Hachman |first1=Mark |title=Midjourney's enthralling AI art generator goes live for everyone |url=https://www.pcworld.com/article/820518/midjourneys-ai-art-goes-live-for-everyone.html |access-date=September 5, 2022 |work=PCWorld |date=July 26, 2022 |language=en |archive-date=October 20, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221020181252/https://www.pcworld.com/article/820518/midjourneys-ai-art-goes-live-for-everyone.html |url-status=live }} ==History== Midjourney, Inc. was founded in [[San Francisco|San Francisco, California]], by David Holz,{{Cite web |last=Salkowitz |first=Rob |date=2022-09-16 |title=Midjourney Founder David Holz On The Impact Of AI On Art, Imagination And The Creative Economy |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/robsalkowitz/2022/09/16/midjourney-founder-david-holz-on-the-impact-of-ai-on-art-imagination-and-the-creative-economy/ |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=Forbes |language=en |archive-date=June 28, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230628234903/https://www.forbes.com/sites/robsalkowitz/2022/09/16/midjourney-founder-david-holz-on-the-impact-of-ai-on-art-imagination-and-the-creative-economy/ |url-status=live }} previously co-founder of Leap Motion.{{Cite web |last=Vincent |first=James |date=2022-08-02 |title="An engine for the imagination": an interview with David Holz, CEO of AI image generator Midjourney |url=https://www.theverge.com/2022/8/2/23287173/ai-image-generation-art-midjourney-multiverse-interview-david-holz |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=The Verge |language=en-US |archive-date=September 20, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230920181147/https://www.theverge.com/2022/8/2/23287173/ai-image-generation-art-midjourney-multiverse-interview-david-holz |url-status=live }} The Midjourney image generation platform first entered open beta on July 12, 2022. On March 14, 2022, the Discord server launched with a request to post high-quality photographs to Twitter/Reddit for system's training.{{cn|date=November 2023}} === Model versions === The company has been working on improving its algorithms, releasing new model versions every few months. Version 2 of their algorithm was launched in April 2022{{Cite tweet |number=1516138949219024898 |user=midjourney |title=We recently started testing a V2 algorithm, it's much better with characters and animals |date=2022-04-18 |access-date=2023-03-19}} and version 3 on July 25.{{Cite tweet |number=1551560891254001664 |user=midjourney |title=Today we're starting to test our V3 image generation algorithms |date=2022-07-25 |access-date=2023-03-19}} On November 5, 2022, the alpha iteration of version 4 was released to users.{{Cite web |date=2022-11-05 |title=David Holz on the official Midjourney Discord server |url=https://discord.com/channels/662267976984297473/952771221915840552/1038335529747480607 |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=Discord |archive-date=May 21, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230521183855/https://discord.com/channels/662267976984297473/952771221915840552/1038335529747480607 |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |title=Midjourney v4 greatly improves the award-winning image creation AI |url=https://www.techspot.com/news/96619-midjourney-v4-greatly-improves-award-winning-image-creation.html |access-date=2022-11-17 |website=TechSpot |date=10 November 2022 |language=en-US |archive-date=November 17, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221117074346/https://www.techspot.com/news/96619-midjourney-v4-greatly-improves-award-winning-image-creation.html |url-status=live }} On March 15, 2023, the alpha iteration of version 5 was released.{{Cite web |title=Midjourney V5 Creates Better Images, Fewer Nightmare Hands |url=https://www.howtogeek.com/879711/midjourney-v5-creates-better-images-fewer-nightmare-hands/ |access-date=2023-03-16 |website=HowToGeek |date=16 March 2023 |language=en-US |archive-date=March 31, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230331162212/https://www.howtogeek.com/879711/midjourney-v5-creates-better-images-fewer-nightmare-hands/ |url-status=live }} The 5.1 model is more opinionated than version 5, applying more of its own stylization to images, while the 5.1 RAW model adds improvement while working better with more literal prompts. After version 5.2 is released with a increasingly better image quality.{{cn|date=November 2023}} On December 21, 2023, the alpha iteration of version 6 was released. The model was trained from scratch over a nine month period. Support was added for better text rendition and a more literal interpretation of prompts. {| | style="vertical-align: top;" | {| class="wikitable" align="center" ! colspan="2" | Regular models |- ! Version !! Release date |- | V1 || February 2022{{Cite web |title=Midjourney Model Versions |url=https://docs.midjourney.com/legacy/docs/models |access-date=2023-09-25 |website=docs.midjourney.com |language=en |archive-date=September 26, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230926024422/https://docs.midjourney.com/legacy/docs/models |url-status=live }} |- | V2 || April 12, 2022 |- | V3 || July 25, 2022 |- | V4 || November 5, 2022 (alpha) |- | V5 || March 15, 2023 (alpha) |- | V5.1 || May 3, 2023{{Cite web |last=Collins |first=Barry |date=2023-05-03 |title=Midjourney 5.1 Arrives - And It's Another Leap Forward For AI Art |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/barrycollins/2023/05/03/midjourney-51-arrivesand-its-another-leap-forward-for-ai-art/ |access-date=2023-05-05 |website=Forbes |language=en |archive-date=May 28, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230528012218/https://www.forbes.com/sites/barrycollins/2023/05/03/midjourney-51-arrivesand-its-another-leap-forward-for-ai-art/ |url-status=live }} |- |V5.2 |||June 22, 2023{{cite news |last1=Edwards |first1=Benj |title="Stunning"—Midjourney update wows AI artists with camera-like feature |url=https://arstechnica.com/information-technology/2023/06/stunning-midjourney-update-wows-ai-artists-with-camera-like-feature/ |access-date=25 June 2023 |work=Ars Technica |date=23 June 2023 |language=en-us |archive-date=September 21, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230921142904/https://arstechnica.com/information-technology/2023/06/stunning-midjourney-update-wows-ai-artists-with-camera-like-feature/ |url-status=live }} |- | V6 ||| December 21, 2023 (alpha){{cite web |last1=Franzen |first1=Carl |title=Midjourney V6 is here with in-image text and completely overhauled prompting |url=https://venturebeat.com/ai/midjourney-v6-is-here-with-in-image-text-and-completely-overhauled-prompting/ |website=VentureBeat |date=21 December 2023}} |} | style="vertical-align: top;" | :{| class="wikitable" align="center" ! colspan="3" | Other models |- ! Version !! Release date !! Notes |- | --beta || August 22, 2022 || |- | test/testp || August 28, 2022 || |- | Niji || December 20, 2022 || rowspan="2" | Collaboration between Midjourney and Spellbrush
tuned to produce [[anime]] and illustrative styles |- | Niji 5 || April 2, 2023 |} |} ==Functionality== Midjourney is currently only accessible through a Discord bot on their official Discord server, by direct messaging the bot, or by inviting the bot to a third party server. To generate images, users use the {{code|/imagine}} command and type in a prompt;{{Cite news |last1=Becker |first1=Isaac Stanley |last2=Harwell |first2=Drew |date=March 30, 2023 |title=How a tiny company with few rules is making fake images go mainstream |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/03/30/midjourney-ai-image-generation-rules/ |newspaper=The Washington Post |access-date=July 22, 2023 |archive-date=May 27, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230527052141/https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/03/30/midjourney-ai-image-generation-rules/ |url-status=live }} the bot then returns a set of four images. Users may then choose which images they want to [[Image scaling|upscale]]. Midjourney is also working on a web interface.{{cn|date=August 2023}} Beyond the {{code|/imagine}} command, Midjourney offers many other commands to send to the Discord bot. Including but not limited to the {{code|/blend}} command which allows the user to blend two images, the {{code|/shorten}} command allowing the user to get suggestions on how to make a long prompt shorter, and others which improve upon the Midjourney experience.{{cn|date=November 2023}} ==Uses== Founder David Holz says he sees artists as customers, not competitors of Midjourney. Holz told ''The Register'' that artists use Midjourney for [[rapid prototyping]] of artistic concepts to show to clients before starting work themselves. Some artists have accused Midjourney of devaluing original creative work by using it in the [[Training, validation, and test data sets|training set]]; Midjourney's terms of service includes a [[Digital Millennium Copyright Act|DMCA]] takedown policy, allowing artists to request their work to be removed from the set if they believe [[copyright infringement]] to be evident.{{Cite web |title=Terms of Service |url=https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/terms-of-service |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=Midjourney |language=en |archive-date=October 6, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231006185033/https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/terms-of-service |url-status=live }} The advertising industry has been quick to embrace AI tools such as Midjourney, DALL-E, and Stable Diffusion, among others. The tools, which enable advertisers to create original content and brainstorm ideas quickly are providing new opportunities, such as "custom ads created for individuals, a new way to create special effects, or even making e-commerce advertising more efficient", according to ''[[Ad Age]]''.{{Cite web |last=Bonilla |first=Brian |date=2022-09-22 |title=How ad agencies are using AI image generators—and how they could be used in the future |url=https://adage.com/article/agency-news/how-agencies-use-ai-image-generators-dalle-e-2-midjourney-and-stable-diffusion/2430126 |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=Ad Age |language=en |archive-date=April 5, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230405211426/https://adage.com/article/agency-news/how-agencies-use-ai-image-generators-dalle-e-2-midjourney-and-stable-diffusion/2430126 |url-status=live }} Architects have described using the software to generate [[mood board]]s for the early stages of projects, as an alternative to searching [[Google Images]].{{cite news |title=The Architects Designing Surreal Worlds with AI |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2023-01-31/architects-embrace-ai-art-generator-midjourney |access-date=14 August 2023 |work=Bloomberg.com |date=31 January 2023 |language=en |archive-date=February 3, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230203082223/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2023-01-31/architects-embrace-ai-art-generator-midjourney |url-status=live }} ===Notable usage and controversy=== [[File:Théâtre D’opéra Spatial.png|thumb|''[[Théâtre D'opéra Spatial]]'', a Midjourney image that won first prize in a digital art competition]] [[File:Alice-and-Sparkle-claw-hand.jpg|thumb|Image from ''[[Alice and Sparkle]]'', a children's book illustrated by Midjourney. ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' describes this image as "showing the limits of the AI-powered technology. The illustration has several apparent flaws, including the character appearing to have claws."{{Cite magazine |date=2022-12-14 |title=He Made A Children's Book Using AI. Artists Are Not Happy |url=https://time.com/6240569/ai-childrens-book-alice-and-sparkle-artists-unhappy/ |access-date=2023-08-19 |magazine=Time |language=en |archive-date=September 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230912005856/https://time.com/6240569/ai-childrens-book-alice-and-sparkle-artists-unhappy/ |url-status=live }}]] The program was used by the British magazine ''[[The Economist]]'' to create the front cover for an issue in June 2022.{{cite news |title=How a computer designed this week's cover |url=https://www.economist.com/news/2022/06/11/how-a-computer-designed-this-weeks-cover |access-date=26 June 2022 |newspaper=The Economist |archive-date=June 26, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220626061822/https://www.economist.com/news/2022/06/11/how-a-computer-designed-this-weeks-cover |url-status=live }}{{cite web |last1=Liu |first1=Gloria |title=DALL-E 2 Made Its First Magazine Cover |url=https://www.cosmopolitan.com/lifestyle/a40314356/dall-e-2-artificial-intelligence-cover/ |website=Cosmopolitan |access-date=26 June 2022 |date=21 June 2022 |archive-date=November 18, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221118152617/https://www.cosmopolitan.com/lifestyle/a40314356/dall-e-2-artificial-intelligence-cover/ |url-status=live }} In Italy, the leading newspaper ''[[Corriere della Sera]]'' published a comic created with Midjourney by writer Vanni Santoni in August 2022.{{cite news |last=Bozzi |first=Ida |date=2022-08-26 |title=Su "La Lettura", Highsmith inedita e le città che mutano |newspaper=Corriere della Sera |language=it-IT |url=https://www.corriere.it/la-lettura/22_agosto_26/su-la-lettura-highsmith-inedita-citta-europee-trasformazione-af21cf38-2522-11ed-9c55-2dc9b0266fc8.shtml |access-date=2023-03-19 |archive-date=April 30, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230430161801/https://www.corriere.it/la-lettura/22_agosto_26/su-la-lettura-highsmith-inedita-citta-europee-trasformazione-af21cf38-2522-11ed-9c55-2dc9b0266fc8.shtml |url-status=live }} Charlie Warzel used Midjourney to generate two images of [[Alex Jones]] for Warzel's newsletter in ''[[The Atlantic]]''. The use of an AI-generated cover was criticised by people who felt it was taking jobs from artists. Warzel called his action a mistake in an article about his decision to use generated images.{{Cite web |date=2022-08-17 |title=I Went Viral in the Bad Way |url=https://newsletters.theatlantic.com/galaxy-brain/62fc502abcbd490021afea1e/twitter-viral-outrage-ai-art/ |access-date=2022-08-31 |website=Galaxy Brain |language=en |archive-date=October 2, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231002115216/https://newsletters.theatlantic.com/galaxy-brain/62fc502abcbd490021afea1e/twitter-viral-outrage-ai-art/ |url-status=live }} ''[[Last Week Tonight with John Oliver]]'' included a 10-minute segment on Midjourney in an episode broadcast in August 2022.{{cite news |last1=Gentile |first1=Dan |title=John Oliver is weirdly popular on this SF-based AI image app |url=https://www.sfgate.com/streaming/article/hbo-john-oliver-ai-midjourney-17374718.php |access-date=August 31, 2022 |work=SFGATE |date=August 16, 2022 |archive-date=April 8, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230408185623/https://www.sfgate.com/streaming/article/hbo-john-oliver-ai-midjourney-17374718.php |url-status=live }}{{cite news |last1=Brathwaite |first1=Lester Fabian |title=John Oliver marries a cabbage in ceremony officiated by Steve Buscemi on 'Last Week Tonight' |url=https://ew.com/tv/john-oliver-marries-cabbage-steve-buscemi/ |access-date=August 31, 2022 |work=EW.com |date=August 29, 2022 |language=en |archive-date=March 26, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230326213507/https://ew.com/tv/john-oliver-marries-cabbage-steve-buscemi/ |url-status=live }} A Midjourney image called ''[[Théâtre D'opéra Spatial]]'' won first place in the digital art competition at the 2022 [[Colorado State Fair]]. Jason Allen, who wrote the [[Prompt engineering|prompt]] that led Midjourney to generate the image, printed the image onto a canvas and entered it into the competition using the name Jason M. Allen via Midjourney. Other digital artists were upset by the news.{{cite news |last1=Gault |first1=Matthew |title=An AI-Generated Artwork Won First Place at a State Fair Fine Arts Competition, and Artists Are Pissed |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/bvmvqm/an-ai-generated-artwork-won-first-place-at-a-state-fair-fine-arts-competition-and-artists-are-pissed |access-date=August 31, 2022 |work=Motherboard |publisher=Vice |date=August 31, 2022 |language=en |archive-date=November 14, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221114194357/http://www.vice.com/en/article/bvmvqm/an-ai-generated-artwork-won-first-place-at-a-state-fair-fine-arts-competition-and-artists-are-pissed |url-status=live }} Allen was unapologetic, insisting that he followed the competition's rules. The two category judges were unaware that Midjourney used AI to generate images, although they later said that had they known this, they would have awarded Allen the top prize anyway.{{cite news |last1=Roose |first1=Kevin |title=An A.I.-Generated Picture Won an Art Prize. Artists Aren't Happy. |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/09/02/technology/ai-artificial-intelligence-artists.html |access-date=September 2, 2022 |work=The New York Times |date=September 2, 2022 |archive-date=May 31, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230531203858/https://www.nytimes.com/2022/09/02/technology/ai-artificial-intelligence-artists.html |url-status=live }} In December 2022, Midjourney was used to create the images in an AI-generated [[Children's literature|children's book]] in the span of a weekend. Titled ''[[Alice and Sparkle]]'', the book features a young girl who builds a robot that becomes self-aware. The creator, Ammaar Reeshi, spent hours tweaking Midjourney prompts, rejecting hundreds of generated results to ultimately choose 13 illustrations for the book.{{Cite web |last=Stokel-Walker |first=Chris |date=13 December 2022 |title=A Tech Worker Is Selling A Children's Book He Made Using AI. Professional Illustrators Are Pissed. |url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/chrisstokelwalker/tech-worker-ai-childrens-book-angers-illustrators |access-date=19 December 2022 |website=[[BuzzFeed]] News |archive-date=April 26, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230426225543/https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/chrisstokelwalker/tech-worker-ai-childrens-book-angers-illustrators |url-status=live }} Both the product and process drew criticism. One artist wrote that "the main problem... is that it was trained off of artists' work. It's our creations, our distinct styles that we created, that we did not consent to being used."{{Cite magazine |last=Popli |first=Nic |date=14 December 2022 |title=He Used AI to Publish a Children's Book in a Weekend. Artists Are Not Happy About It |url=https://time.com/6240569/ai-childrens-book-alice-and-sparkle-artists-unhappy/ |access-date=19 December 2022 |magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |archive-date=September 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230912005856/https://time.com/6240569/ai-childrens-book-alice-and-sparkle-artists-unhappy/ |url-status=live }} [[File:Pope Francis in puffy winter jacket.jpg|thumb|A fake Midjourney-created image of [[Pope Francis]] wearing a puffer jacket, which went viral in 2023]] In 2023, the realism of AI-based [[text-to-image model|text-to-image]] generators, such as Midjourney, [[DALL-E]], or [[Stable Diffusion]],{{Cite news |last1=Verma |first1=Pranshu |last2=Schaul |first2=Kevin |title=See why AI like ChatGPT has gotten so good, so fast |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/interactive/2023/artificial-intelligence-tech-rapid-advances/ |access-date=2023-05-28 |newspaper=Washington Post |language=en |archive-date=May 29, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230529164520/https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/interactive/2023/artificial-intelligence-tech-rapid-advances/ |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |date=2023-04-11 |title=Will AI-generated images create a new crisis for fact-checkers? Experts are not so sure |url=https://reutersinstitute.politics.ox.ac.uk/news/will-ai-generated-images-create-new-crisis-fact-checkers-experts-are-not-so-sure |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism |language=en |archive-date=May 28, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230528153913/https://reutersinstitute.politics.ox.ac.uk/news/will-ai-generated-images-create-new-crisis-fact-checkers-experts-are-not-so-sure |url-status=live }} reached such a high level that it led to a significant wave of [[Viral phenomenon|viral]] AI-generated photos. Widespread attention was gained by a Midjourney-generated photo of [[Pope Francis]] wearing a white puffer coat,{{Cite web |last=Novak |first=Matt |title=That Viral Image Of Pope Francis Wearing A White Puffer Coat Is Totally Fake |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/mattnovak/2023/03/26/that-viral-image-of-pope-francis-wearing-a-white-puffer-coat-is-totally-fake/ |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=Forbes |language=en |archive-date=May 28, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230528153912/https://www.forbes.com/sites/mattnovak/2023/03/26/that-viral-image-of-pope-francis-wearing-a-white-puffer-coat-is-totally-fake/ |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |last=Stokel-Walker |first=Chris |date=2023-03-27 |title=We Spoke To The Guy Who Created The Viral AI Image Of The Pope That Fooled The World |url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/chrisstokelwalker/pope-puffy-jacket-ai-midjourney-image-creator-interview |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=BuzzFeed News |language=en |archive-date=May 28, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230528090246/https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/chrisstokelwalker/pope-puffy-jacket-ai-midjourney-image-creator-interview |url-status=live }} the fictional arrest of [[Donald Trump]],{{Cite web |date=2023-03-24 |title=Trump shares deepfake photo of himself praying as AI images of arrest spread online |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/donald-trump-ai-praying-photo-b2307178.html |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=The Independent |language=en |archive-date=May 28, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230528154052/https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/donald-trump-ai-praying-photo-b2307178.html |url-status=live }} and a hoax of an attack on the [[The Pentagon|Pentagon]],{{Cite news |last1=Oremus |first1=Will |last2=Harwell |first2=Drew |last3=Armus |first3=Teo |date=2023-05-22 |title=A tweet about a Pentagon explosion was fake. It still went viral. |language=en-US |newspaper=Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/05/22/pentagon-explosion-ai-image-hoax/ |access-date=2023-05-28 |issn=0190-8286 |archive-date=May 28, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230528005037/https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/05/22/pentagon-explosion-ai-image-hoax/ |url-status=live }} as well as the usage in professional creative arts.{{Cite web |last=Kolirin |first=Lianne |date=2023-04-18 |title=Artist rejects photo prize after AI-generated image wins award |url=https://www.cnn.com/style/article/ai-photo-win-sony-scli-intl/index.html |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=CNN |language=en |archive-date=May 28, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230528153912/https://www.cnn.com/style/article/ai-photo-win-sony-scli-intl/index.html |url-status=live }}{{Cite news|date=2023-06-16|title=How Generative AI Can Augment Human Creativity|work=Harvard Business Review|url=https://hbr.org/2023/07/how-generative-ai-can-augment-human-creativity|access-date=2023-06-20|issn=0017-8012|archive-date=June 20, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230620073042/https://hbr.org/2023/07/how-generative-ai-can-augment-human-creativity|url-status=live}} Research has suggested that the images Midjourney generates can be biased. For example, even neutral prompts in one study returned unequal results on the aspects of gender, skin color, and location.{{Cite journal |last1=Thomas |first1=Ryan J. |last2=Thomson |first2=T. J. |date=2023-07-07 |title=What Does a Journalist Look like? Visualizing Journalistic Roles through AI |journal=Digital Journalism |language=en |pages=1–23 |doi=10.1080/21670811.2023.2229883 |issn=2167-0811|doi-access=free }} A study by researchers at the nonprofit group [[Center for Countering Digital Hate]] found the tool to be easy to generate racist and conspiratorial images.{{cite news |last=Alba |first=Davey |date=August 11, 2023 |title=Midjourney Is Easily Tricked Into Making AI Misinformation, Study Finds |publisher=Bloomberg |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2023-08-11/midjourney-rules-can-easily-break-with-certain-prompts |url-status=live |access-date=November 21, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231121162147/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2023-08-11/midjourney-rules-can-easily-break-with-certain-prompts |archive-date=November 21, 2023 |issn=1063-2123}} ==== Content moderation and censorship in Midjourney ==== Prior to May 2023, Midjourney implemented a moderation mechanism predicated on a banned words system. This method prohibited the use of language associated with explicit content, such as sexual or pornographic themes, as well as extreme violence. Moreover, the system also banned certain individual words including religious and political figures, such as [[Allah]] or [[Xi Jinping]]. This practice occasionally stirred controversy due to perceived instances of censorship within the Midjourney platform.{{cite web |last1=McLaughlin |first1=Sarah |title=Midjourney CEO Says 'Political Satire In China Is Pretty Not Okay,' But Apparently Silencing Satire About Xi Jinping Is Pretty Okay |url=https://www.techdirt.com/2023/03/31/midjourney-ceo-says-political-satire-in-china-is-pretty-not-okay-but-apparently-silencing-satire-about-xi-jinping-is-pretty-okay/ |website=Techdirt |access-date=26 August 2023 |date=31 March 2023 |archive-date=August 26, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230826104504/https://www.techdirt.com/2023/03/31/midjourney-ceo-says-political-satire-in-china-is-pretty-not-okay-but-apparently-silencing-satire-about-xi-jinping-is-pretty-okay/ |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |last=McFadden |first=Christopher |date=2023-04-03 |title=Midjourney will no longer let you generate images of Xi Jinping |url=https://interestingengineering.com/culture/midjourney-bans-xi-jinping-images |access-date=2023-05-21 |website=interestingengineering.com |language=en-US |archive-date=June 1, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230601130429/https://interestingengineering.com/culture/midjourney-bans-xi-jinping-images |url-status=live }} Commencing in May 2023, with subsequent updates post version 5, Midjourney transitioned to an AI-powered content moderation system. This advanced mechanism allowed for a more nuanced interpretation of user prompts by analyzing them in their entirety. It consequently facilitated the context-dependent use of words that had previously been prohibited. For instance, users can now prompt the AI to generate a portrait of Xi Jinping. At the same time, the system will prevent the generation of contentious images, such as depictions of global leaders, including Xi Jinping, in situations of arrest.{{Cite web |last=Bastian |first=Matthias |date=2023-05-03 |title=Midjourney now has an easy mode and a new AI moderation system |url=https://the-decoder.com/midjourney-now-has-an-easy-mode-and-a-new-ai-moderation-system/ |access-date=2023-05-21 |website=THE DECODER |language=en-US |archive-date=May 21, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230521121637/https://the-decoder.com/midjourney-now-has-an-easy-mode-and-a-new-ai-moderation-system/ |url-status=live }} ==Litigation== On January 13, 2023, three artists – [[Sarah Andersen]], [[Kelly McKernan]], and Karla Ortiz – filed a [[copyright infringement]] lawsuit against [[Stability AI]], Midjourney, and [[DeviantArt]], claiming that these companies have infringed the rights of millions of artists, by training AI tools on five billion images scraped from the web, without the consent of the original artists.{{Cite web |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/1/16/23557098/generative-ai-art-copyright-legal-lawsuit-stable-diffusion-midjourney-deviantart |title=AI art tools Stable Diffusion and Midjourney targeted with copyright lawsuit |first=James |last=Vincent |date=2023-01-16 |website=The Verge |accessdate= |archive-date=March 9, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230309010528/https://www.theverge.com/2023/1/16/23557098/generative-ai-art-copyright-legal-lawsuit-stable-diffusion-midjourney-deviantart |url-status=live }} The legal action was initiated in San Francisco by attorney [[Matthew Butterick]] in partnership with the Joseph Saveri Law Firm, the same team challenging [[Microsoft]], [[GitHub]], and [[OpenAI]] (developer of [[ChatGPT]] and [[DALL-E]]) in court. In July 2023, U.S. District Judge [[William Orrick III|William Orrick]] inclined to dismiss most of the lawsuit filed by Andersen, McKernan, and Ortiz but allowed them to file a new complaint.{{Cite news |last=Brittain |first=Blake |date=2023-07-19 |title=US judge finds flaws in artists' lawsuit against AI companies |language=en |work=Reuters |url=https://www.reuters.com/legal/litigation/us-judge-finds-flaws-artists-lawsuit-against-ai-companies-2023-07-19/ |access-date=2023-08-06 |archive-date=September 6, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230906193839/https://www.reuters.com/legal/litigation/us-judge-finds-flaws-artists-lawsuit-against-ai-companies-2023-07-19/ |url-status=live }} == Subscription service == Midjourney had three subscription tiers,{{When|date=September 2023}} which included a trial good for 25 image generations; the company withdrew it,{{When|date=September 2023}} citing high demand and misuse.{{Cite web |title=Midjourney Subscription Plans |url=https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/plans |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=docs.midjourney.com |language=en |archive-date=September 26, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230926164453/https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/plans |url-status=live }} As of September 2023, Midjourney costs between $10 and $120 per month, depending on the plan.{{cite web |title=Midjourney Subscription Plans |url=https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/plans |website=docs.midjourney.com |access-date=21 September 2023 |language=en |archive-date=September 26, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230926164453/https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/plans |url-status=live }} == See also == * [[Artificial intelligence art]] * [[Computer art]] * [[Generative art]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commonscat}} * {{Official website|https://www.midjourney.com/}} {{Differentiable computing}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Artificial intelligence art]] [[Category:Art controversies]] [[Category:Unsupervised learning]] [[Category:Text-to-image generation]] [[Category:Deep learning software applications]] [[Category:Works involved in plagiarism controversies]] [[Category:Computer-related introductions in 2022]]
